generated_json.title: History of present illness
content: The patient is a 65-year-old female presenting with ongoing knee pain, swelling, and warmth, particularly on the lateral aspect of the right knee. She reports that the knee has been increasingly painful and hot, describing a sensation of it feeling like it might boil. The pain is exacerbated by bending the knee at the level of the bed, especially when lying on her left side. She notes that the popliteus area is tender and that she has difficulty with knee extension, although her range of motion has improved since her recent knee replacement. She reports that physical therapy has been delayed due to lack of prescription, but she is scheduled to begin PT on Thursday. She also inquired about the duration of antibiotic prophylaxis for dental procedures, expressing concern after learning about the recommendation two days prior. She was advised that prophylactic antibiotics are recommended for two years post-knee replacement due to the risk of bacterial seeding from oral flora leading to prosthetic joint infection. She is currently not taking any antibiotics and is awaiting a prescription for cephalexin for dental prophylaxis. She denies any recent trauma or infection but is concerned about the potential for infection related to her prosthetic knee.
generated_json.instruction:
Provide a detailed summary of the patient's current illness based on their report. Include a thorough description of symptoms, noting their onset, duration, and severity. Discuss any changes or developments in symptoms since onset and identify factors that may exacerbate or relate to these symptoms, such as specific activities, foods, or medications. Document any prior treatments or remedies the patient has attempted, noting their efficacy. Describe how these symptoms impact the patientâ€™s daily activities, overall well-being, and quality of life. Capture information about any individuals mentioned by the patient, specifying their relationship and any pertinent interactions or conversations related to the illness.

Ensure that no information regarding the treatment plan is included.

sub-section.title: Assessment
content: Right knee replacement with postoperative pain and inflammation
Suspected overuse or strain of the popliteus and IT band
Need for continued physical therapy following knee replacement

sub-section.title: Plan
content: Prescribed cephalexin (Keflex) 500 mg orally four times daily for one hour before dental procedures for a duration of two years as prophylaxis against prosthetic joint infection.
Re-upped physical therapy: two times per week for eight weeks to improve range of motion and strength in the right knee.
Scheduled follow-up visit in eight weeks to assess progress and adjust rehabilitation plan as needed.
Patient educated on the importance of antibiotic prophylaxis for dental procedures and the rationale behind the two-year recommendation.
Patient advised to continue home exercises and avoid positions that exacerbate knee pain, particularly bending at bed level on the left side.
Instructed to contact office if signs of infection (increased warmth, swelling, redness, fever) develop.
sub-section.default: No plan
sub-section.instruction: Detail the healthcare provider's plan of action to manage the patient's condition, specifying treatments, medications (include ongoing medications briefly), procedures, therapies, lifestyle modifications, referrals to specialists, patient education on condition and medications, and recommendations for counselings or support services. Dont provide any follow up details in this section.
